questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to configure email for Trey Research.
What should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

HOTSPOT -
You need to resolve the Outlook issue reported by the Contoso users.
How should you complete the command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
i think correct is
New-TransportRule -Name "FabrikamAttachments" -AttachmentIsUnsupported $true -ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords "Fabrikam" -ModerateMessageByUser moderator@contoso.com

New-TransportRule -Name "FabrikamAttachments" -AttachmentIsUnsupported $true -ExceptIfSenderDomainIs "Fabrikam" -ModerateMessageByUser moderator@contoso.com

The rule will filter all messages with unsupported attachments unless they are internal to Fabrikam domain. There is a typo in the proposed answer. The ExceptIfFromAddressContainsWords wion't work because it will filter any email address containig "Fabrikam", not only the internal ones.
The switch is actually "-ExceptIfSenderDomainIs" so that rules the second answer out. Unless this is a typo?

Not Correct:
Attachments Supported
OK

ExceptIfFromAdressContainswords 
"Fabrikam is not a domain. It's a word contained in an email adress

discussion.content: Answer is correct. With adaptive scope you can set a scope based on a query. In our case all users from compliance team. See here fpr more information. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/retention-settings?view=o365-worldwide#configuration-information-for-adaptive-scopes
